item.title: Coreen add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Draw your chair up close to the edge of the precipice and I’ll tell you a story." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Coreen add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "He's more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Coreen add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Coreen add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "In the silence of the heart God speaks. If you face God in prayer and silence, God will speak to you. Then you will know that you are nothing. It is only when you realize your nothingness, your emptiness, that God can fill you with Himself. Souls of prayer are souls of great silence." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Coreen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I can write the saddest poem of all tonight. I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too." -- Pablo Neruda
